data.title: Where are Steph Curry's first Warriors teammates now?
data.meta_description: With Stephen Curry on the cusp of surpassing Wilt Chamberlain as the Warriors' all-time leader in points, here's a look at where those teammates who were on the court for his first NBA points are now.
data.text:
With Stephen Curry on the cusp of surpassing Wilt Chamberlain as the Warriors’ all-time leader in points, here’s a look at where those teammates who were on the court for his first NBA points are now.

Andris Biedrins: Biedrins and Curry were teammates until 2013, at which point the Warriors traded Biedrins to Utah in a three-team deal to acquire Andre Iguodala. He played his last six NBA games with the Jazz before he was waived. Biedrins spoke to the Bay Area News Group over the phone from Latvia.

Stephen Curry: Curry is playing his 12th season with the Warriors. Already the franchise’s all-time leader in assists and 3-pointers, he’s on track to catch several all-time greats.

Monta Ellis: Ellis was traded by Golden State to Milwaukee in 2012, where he played two seasons before finishing his 12-year career in Dallas and then Indiana. In seven seasons with the Warriors, Ellis averaged nearly 20 points and five assists per game. Now he lives in Dallas, where he runs a basketball training school called “Ellis Elite.”

https://open.spotify.com/episode/1GRrVIqXr2i5GysbR78cDW?si=VKRyAKBlT3CYbb18OKED9g

Stephen Jackson: Since he last played in the NBA in 2014, Jackson has remained in the public eye with his podcast “All The Smoke” and through his activism following the 2020 death of his friend George Floyd.

Ronny Turiaf: Turiaf, who grew up in France and played collegiately at Gonzaga, played 10 seasons in the NBA. After stints with the Warriors, Lakers and Knicks, Turiaf won the 2012 championship as a member of the Miami Heat. He last played in 2015. He spoke to the Bay Area News Group over the phone from Portugal.

READ THE STORY: As Steph Curry nears Wilt’s Warriors record, ’09-10 teammates recall his first basket

Warriors’ all-time leaders in points (for now)

1. Wilt Chamberlain: 17,783

2. Stephen Curry: 17,695

3. Rick Barry: 16,447

4. Paul Arizin: 16,266

5. Chris Mullin: 16,235

6. Nate Thurmond: 13,191

7. Jeff Mullins: 12,547

8. Klay Thompson: 11,995

9. Purvis Short: 11,894

10. Neil Johnston: 10,023
